III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4111 Job Description
Section (1) An institution shall provide a job description for each staff
Description position that identifies rules, required qualifications, and lines of
authority.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation A staff member was in the role of a LPC and was providing
therapy services without being licensed in the State of Michigan.
Investigation Interviews:
MDHHS Worker/Complaint Source was interviewed via phone
on July 31, 2023. MDHHS Worker reported she completed her
contract evaluation for the facility on July 9, 2023, and found
Therapist to not be a licensed therapist in the State of Michigan.
She reported Therapist is licensed through the State of Virginia
and Clinical Supervisor was helping assist to get his license active
in the State of Michigan. MDHHS Worker reported Therapist has
been employed at the facility for a couple of years. She stated that
she did not review the job description for the position. MDHHS
Worker reported when she talked with Clinical Supervisor, he
reported he was working on changing the policy and procedure to
ensure this does not happen again. MDHHS Worker reported she
never saw the original policy surrounding the requirements for the
therapist role and has asked for it but never received it. She
reported she spoke with Clinical Supervisor today who reported
they are still working with the State of Michigan to get Therapist’s
license active in this state but as of now it is still pending.
Currently Therapist is not providing therapy to the youth as of
today. MDHHS Worker reported a complaint is also being filed
with the Michigan Department of Licensing and Regulatory Affairs
(LARA).
Clinical Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility
on August 1, 2023. Clinical Supervisor reported Therapist was
hired in April 2019 due to meeting the job requirements for the
residential therapist. He reported the residential therapist
requirements include a master’s degree and eligibility to obtain a
professional license in the State of Michigan. Clinical Supervisor
reported Therapist has an LPC license in the State of Virginia
which made him meet the requirement that he is eligible in the
State of Michigan since he has one in another state. He reported it
was reported that at the start of employment, Therapist worked
with the State of Michigan to get his license open in Michigan.
Clinical Supervisor reported since Therapist was licensed by the
Commonwealth of Virginia, he could apply for licensure by
endorsement which he did and had an application submitted.
Clinical Supervisor reported when the facility had their contract
audit completed by MDHHS Worker and she noted the lack of
licensure was found, Therapist talked with the State of Michigan
Licensing and completed an application as he was told his
application was old. Clinical Supervisor reported he has had
formal monthly supervision and informal weekly supervision with
Therapist. Since the finding of the concern with licensure
2

Therapist stopped providing therapy while getting the license
situated. Clinical supervisor reported there was no policy or
procedure in place about tracking staff’s licensures, so this was
created in response. A form was also created to be used yearly to
track annual training responsibility, monthly supervision, and
licensure requirements by the Clinical Supervisor.
LARA Worker was interviewed via phone on August 1,
2023. State of Michigan Licensing and Regulatory Affairs (LARA)
was contacted to speak about the requirements for the transition
of an LPC license from one state to Michigan. LARA Worker
reported Therapist would need to submit an application to
transition the license and follow that protocol. She reported the
short answer is a person should not be practicing therapy in a
state unless they are licensed by that state whether it be fully
licensed or limited licensed. LARA Worker reported she was
unsure about a therapist working at a Child Caring Institution
requirements as they do not get billed from insurance directly
which is where a therapist needs to be licensed by the State of
Michigan. She also reported due to COVID-19 there were some
exceptions made to allow people to practice with another state
license in Michigan due to the need for mental health services and
the barriers the pandemic put on getting paperwork processed in a
timely manner. LARA Worker reported there was an application in
April 2019 for Therapist to transfer his license and then another
one just recently in July 2023. She reported she does not have
access to what happened with the April 2019 request. LARA
Worker reported Therapist does not have an active license within
the State of Michigan.
Documents Reviewed:
- Facility Job Description for Residential Therapist: This
document was created on 04/02/2003 and last updated on
03/16/2021. “Residential Therapist facilitate and provide
direct clinical services to youth, consult with other
professional involved with the resident or his family to
ensure coordination of treatment services. The Residential
therapist is accountable for providing case management
services, documentation, and coordination of services
between residential staff and clinical services.” The
essential requirements for hiring of a personal of this role is
the person needs to have at least the following: MSW or
MA/MS degree in human service field; Eligible to obtain
professional licensure in the State of Michigan.
3

- Human Resource File for Therapist- Therapist was hired
at the end of April 2019. All required hiring documentation
was within the file. Therapist has a master’s degree in
counseling/psychology. The file showed Therapist having
an active LPC as of February 2019 and does not expire
until June 2024 within the state of Virginia. The file reflects
Therapist meets the requirements for his job per the
Residential Therapist Job Description.
- Facility Clinical Yearly Tracking Form- This form was
created in July 2023 due to the findings from the contract
evaluation. Clinical Supervisor will track therapist,
recreational therapist, and case manager annual training
responsibility’s, monthly supervision, and license
requirements. This will help ensure all licensing
requirements are being met and maintained.
- Email from Clinical Supervisor dated 08/01/2023- This
email provided the details of Therapist process with LARA.
In January 2019, Therapist applied to open an LPC within
the State of Michigan through LARA. It was reported the
examination that he did in Virginia did not count as it was
not the National Counseling Examination (NCE) but the
National Clinical Mental Health Counseling Examination
(NCMHCE). Both of these examinations are given by the
National Board for Certified Counselors. LARA reported
since Therapist was licensed by the Commonwealth of
Virginia, he could apply for licensure by endorsement.
Since he had a pending application, he thought his
application could continue and that his application for
licensure was addressed with the State of Michigan. This
was all occurring as Therapist was getting hired by the
facility. Clinical Supervisor noted once they were notified by
MDHHS Worker the lack of Licensure, Therapist
immediately called LARA and submitted a new application.
Therapist was told his application had expired and they had
none of the paper records he had previously submitted.
Therapist has resubmitted all new documentation for
licensure, completed his fingerprinting and is awaiting
approval of his CACREP equivalent classes.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance of hiring a therapist that
supports their job description. Therapist meets the requirements of
4

having a master’s degree and is eligible to licensed within the
State of Michigan.
Technical Assistance:
Although DCWL does not regulate professional licenses, the
agency needs to update their practice to be in compliance with
State of Michigan requirements.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
